climbs.name: Too Jug to Fail
climbs.fa: Pete Van Slooten, Sam Huntoon, Troy Anderson, Rob Candland

content.description:
Steep climbing with jugs, stemming, and a tufa. Start with a grungy boulder problem then rally up and pull a cliffhanger like Silvester Stallone.

Bolts are spaced like a gym route, some of the holds are like the big giant gym holds.
content.location: Starts on a nice ledge. Access from one of the other routes nearby or scrambling in from the left side of the crag. There is a ring anchor bolt for the belayer.

climbs.name: Sassy Sister Slim
climbs.fa: Pete Van Slooten, Troy Anderson, Rob Candland

content.description:
Climb low angle jugs to the scoop. Stem the scoop then mount the hanging pillar. Reach around for hidden holds. Good exposure. Bolts appear when needed.

Red hangers

Quickjug is a gently overhung bolt line on the left side of the Jug Haul Wall on the right edge of the scoop    It's more fingery than the other routes.

Also makes for a good place to try/practice your bolt ladder skills.

Rock improves significantly after the second bolt. First bolt is a spinner all others are not.
content.location: Left most route on the Jug Haul Wall.

climbs.name: Brave Brother Badass
climbs.fa: Pete Van Slooten, Troy Anderson, Rob Candland

content.description:
Follow long prow over multiple bulges via jugs. Climb left onto the slab when it get steep and loose. Cool position and formations on route. Exciting lead. Expect some soft rock.

Be very aware while lowering.  Rock can become dislodged by both the rope and the climber.
content.protection: 12 big bolts + 2 chains. Runners and long draws may alleviate rope drag.

climbs.name: [Redacted]
climbs.fa: Pete Van Slooten, Sam Huntoon, Jet, Dignan, Nora

content.description: climb the juggy bulge, paddle over the sandy gulley, then climb the upper headwall via jugs and nipples.  You can avoid the sand section and just climb the upper part by belaying from the big ledge midway up but you’ll miss some steep muggy moves at the bottom. . Access the ledge by traversing in from the base of the  “Quickjug” route up around on the far left side of the crag.
